intro: Harveya andongensis, commonly known as the Andong Harveya, is a flowering plant native to South Korea. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of red and orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Harveya andongensis is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
